net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class SelectableButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractButton
        • net.cloud.gfx.elements.SelectableButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Checkbox, RadioButton

    public abstract class SelectableButton
extends AbstractButton
    A base class for selectable buttons, such as checkboxes and radio buttons. Extends upon the abstract button by actually offering the drawing code, and keeps track of whether or not the button is currently selected.
    In general, a selectable button has 6 sprites - the cross product of normal, focused, pressed and selected, not selected. They are drawn as a button with label text drawn to the right of the button.
    actionPerformed() is still left to subclasses, but this class will take care of toggling selection state.

        public SelectableButton(java.lang.String label,
                        int priority,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height,
                        int firstSpriteID)
        Create a button with the given fields. The parent will be left null.
        Parameters:
        label - The text label to accompany the button
        priority - Z-priority
        x - X-location
        y - Y-location
        width - Width of the button itself
        height - Height of the button itself
        firstSpriteID - The sprite ID of the first background image asset

      • actionPerformed

        protected void actionPerformed()
        Called when the button was pressed or selected via the action key. This will toggle the selection state of the button. Subclasses should call super.actionPerformed() or manually toggle the selection state when this happens.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in class AbstractButton

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Draw the button based on its current state, with label text to the right of the button
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

      • toggleSelected

        public void toggleSelected()
        Convenience method, changes the selection to the opposite state. Equivalent to
        setSelected(!isSelected());

      • setSpriteGroup

        public void setSpriteGroup(int firstID)

        Parameters:
